title: Authors and Citation
text: Callaway B (2025). BMisc: Miscellaneous Functions Panel Data, Quantiles, Printing Results. R package version 1.4.8, https://github.com/bcallaway11/BMisc, https://bcallaway11.github.io/BMisc/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {BMisc: Miscellaneous Functions for Panel Data, Quantiles, and Printing Results},   author = {Brantly Callaway},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.4.8,     https://github.com/bcallaway11/BMisc},   url = {https://bcallaway11.github.io/BMisc/}, }

what: Miscellaneous Functions for Panel Data, Quantiles, and Printing Results
title: Miscellaneous Functions for Panel Data, Quantiles, and Printing Results
text: BMisc includes miscellaneous functions working panel data, quantiles, dealing formulas, among things.

title: Miscellaneous Functions for Panel Data, Quantiles, and Printing Results
text: can install BMisc github : CRAN :

title: Miscellaneous Functions for Panel Data, Quantiles, and Printing Results
text: make_dist creates distribution function vector value random variable corresponding value cdf.
code: library(BMisc) y <- rnorm(100) y <- y[order(y)] u <- runif(100) u <- u[order(u)] F <- make_dist(y, u) class(F) #> [1] "ecdf"     "stepfun"  "function" # plot(F)

title: Miscellaneous Functions for Panel Data, Quantiles, and Printing Results
text: Another useful function make_balanced_panel function drops observations panel dataset available time periods.
code: id <- rep(seq(1, 100, 1), 2) ## individual ids for setting up a two period panel t <- rep(seq(1, 2), 100) ## time periods y <- rnorm(200) ## outcomes dta <- data.frame(id = id, t = t, y = y) ## make into data frame dta <- dta[-7, ] ## drop the 7th row from the dataset (which creates an unbalanced panel) nrow(dta) #> [1] 199 dta <- make_balanced_panel(dta, idname = "id", tname = "t") nrow(dta) ## now all the observations with missing data in any period are dropped #> [1] 198

title: Combine Two Distribution Functions — combine_ecdfs
text: Combines two distribution functions given weights `weights`

title: Combine Two Distribution Functions — combine_ecdfs
text: y.seq sequence possible y values dflist list distribution functions combine weights vector weights put distribution function; weights provided equal weight given distribution function ... additional arguments can past BMisc::make_dist

title: Combine Two Distribution Functions — combine_ecdfs
text: ecdf

title: Combine Two Distribution Functions — combine_ecdfs
code: x <- rnorm(100) y <- rnorm(100, 1, 1) Fx <- ecdf(x) Fy <- ecdf(y) both <- combineDfs(seq(-2, 3, 0.1), list(Fx, Fy)) plot(Fx, col = "green") plot(Fy, col = "blue", add = TRUE) plot(both, add = TRUE)

title: element_wise_mult — element_wise_mult
text: function takes two matrices dimension nxB nxk returns Bxk matrix comes element-wise multiplication every column first matrix times entire second matrix averaging n-dimension.  equivalent (faster ) following R code: `sapply(1:biters, function(b) sqrt(n)*colMeans(Umat[,b]*inf.func))` .  function particularly useful fast computations using multiplier bootstrap.

title: element_wise_mult — element_wise_mult
text: U nxB matrix (e.g., matrix Rademachar weights B bootstrap iterations using multiplier bootstrap inf_func nxk matrix (e.g., matrix containing influence function different parameter estimates)

title: element_wise_mult — element_wise_mult
text: Bxk matrix

title: makeDist — makeDist

title: makeDist — makeDist
code: makeDist(   x,   Fx,   sorted = FALSE,   rearrange = FALSE,   force01 = FALSE,   method = "constant" )

title: makeDist — makeDist
text: x vector values Fx vector distribution function values sorted boolean indicating whether x already sorted; computation somewhat faster already sorted rearrange boolean indicating whether monotize distribution function force01 boolean indicating whether force values distribution function (.e. Fx) 0 1 method method pass approxfun approximate distribution function.  Default "constant"; possible choice "linear".  "constant" returns step function, just like empirical cdf; "linear" linearly interpolates neighboring points.

title: Balance a Panel Data Set — make_balanced_panel
text: data.frame balanced panel

title: Balance a Panel Data Set — make_balanced_panel
code: id <- rep(seq(1, 100), each = 2) # individual ids for setting up a two period panel t <- rep(seq(1, 2), 100) # time periods y <- rnorm(200) # outcomes dta <- data.frame(id = id, t = t, y = y) # make into data frame dta <- dta[-7, ] # drop the 7th row from the dataset (which creates an unbalanced panel) dta <- make_balanced_panel(dta, idname = "id", tname = "t")

text: x vector values Fx vector distribution function values sorted boolean indicating whether x already sorted; computation somewhat faster already sorted rearrange boolean indicating whether monotize distribution function force01 boolean indicating whether force values distribution function (.e. Fx) 0 1 method method pass approxfun approximate distribution function.  Default "constant"; possible choice "linear".  "constant" returns step function, just like empirical cdf; "linear" linearly interpolates neighboring points.

title: Right-hand Side Variables — rhs_vars
code: ff <- yvar ~ x1 + x2 rhs_vars(ff) #> [1] "x1" "x2"  ff <- y ~ x1 + I(x1^2) rhs_vars(ff) #> [1] "x1"      "I(x1^2)"

what: Subsample of Observations from Panel Data — subsample
title: Subsample of Observations from Panel Data — subsample
text: returns subsample panel data set; particular drops  observations keepids.  set,  randomly keeps nkeep observations.

title: Subsample of Observations from Panel Data — subsample
code: subsample(dta, idname, tname, keepids = NULL, nkeep = NULL)

title: Subsample of Observations from Panel Data — subsample
text: dta data.frame balanced panel idname name id variable tname name time variable keepids ids keep nkeep many ids keep (used keepids set); default number unique ids

title: Subsample of Observations from Panel Data — subsample
text: data.frame contains subsample dta

title: Subsample of Observations from Panel Data — subsample
code: data("LaborSupply", package = "plm") nrow(LaborSupply) #> [1] 5320 unique(LaborSupply$year) #>  [1] 1979 1980 1981 1982 1983 1984 1985 1986 1987 1988 ss <- subsample(LaborSupply, "id", "year", nkeep = 100) nrow(ss) #> [1] 1000

title: BMisc 1.4.8
text: added function weighted_combine_list computing weighed averages list matrices vectors modernized function names snake case, keeping older function names available internal functions

title: BMisc 1.4.7
text: CRAN release: 2025-01-10 moved functions t2orig orig2t BMisc pte package add function drop_collinear drop collinear columns matrix add function get_principal_components get unit-specific principal components time-varying variables add function time_invariant_to_panel repeating time-invariant variables, mainly idea adding panel data set update get_group allow non-binary treatments add function check_staggered check panel data set staggered treatment adoption, function can work non-binary treatments

title: BMisc 1.4.6
text: CRAN release: 2024-03-09 Adds functions get_group, get_YiGmin1, get_Yi1 utility functions manipulating data. especially useful settings staggered treatment adoption. Add functions get_lagYi get_first_difference utility functions working panel data. Add function get_Yit recovers outcomes period t units panel. Restore default makeBalancedPanel return data.frame rather data.table. New function argument return_data.table allows returning data.table desired functionality user. Fixes documentation NOTE id2rownum

title: BMisc 1.4.5
text: CRAN release: 2022-07-11 execute examples subsample blockBootSample plm package available (thanks Achim Zeileis)

title: BMisc 1.4.4
text: CRAN release: 2022-01-26 faster version panel2cs2 (thanks Kyle Butts)
